str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Probably strengthened from splen; an intestine; figuratively, pity or sympathy.
Pity, mercy, compassion. Of uncertain affinity; compassion.

str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Neuter Plural

str2: From anatello; a rising of light, i.e. Dawn; by implication, the east.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To look upon, visit, look out, select.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Height, heaven; dignity, eminence. From a derivative of huper; elevation, i.e. altitude, the sky, or dignity.
